link.title: Time to go to bed and watch a film
link.comment: The Usual Suspects tonight
Hooray for cheap DVDs from Canada

link.title: OpenCola tech overview
link.comment: Smart Folders to be released at the P2P conference
I look forwarding to playing with it
Any technology that has something called a Clerver as part of it is OK by me
Hmm, I look forwarding, do I? Duh, guess I still need more sleep.

link.title: RDDL as described by Leigh Dodds
Naming and Addressing: URIs, URLs...
link.comment: Includes a nice Venn diagram of URIs, URNs and URLs
An ASCII Venn diagram, no less. Admirable LoFi.

link.title: Blue Head Tilefish
link.comment: aka Hoplolatilus starcki
From the excellent fish index
The spotted puffer looks cool.

link.title: doesn't look too sunny in SF!
US/Japanese sub collision raises tensions
link.comment: "Even after a swift apology from the US, the accident will add to perennial resentment over the US military presence in Japan, particularly on the Japanese island of Okinawa."
The US troops on Okinawa seem to have behaved pretty despicably.

link.title: Frankenstein exhibition
link.comment: Are you fascinated or appalled?
I'd like to see this, myself.

link.title: RDF Crawler
link.comment: "a java-based tool/API which downloads interconnected fragments of RDF from the Internet and builds a knowledge base from this data"

link.title: Cricket Scoreboard for Linux
link.comment: Not so keen on the graphics, but still sounds very promising.

link.title: Yummy, looks like antialiasing might make its way onto my desktop before long
link.comment: This news article has screesnhots of GNOME and Mozilla apps using the XFree86 XRender extension stuff.
For typeface fetishists everywhere, this has to be happy news.

link.title: Another Palm Pilot desktop organizer suite for Linux
link.comment: Misnamed JPilot, this thing uses GTK+ rather than Java
Although I suppose that to allot 1/26th of everything to Java is a bit over the top.
This reminds me of a text editor I saw advertised on Freshmeat the other day, which was simply called 'J'.
As I observed to MattB, this blatant land-grab for an entire 1/26th of such a restricted namespace seems rather presumptious.
The only 1-letter applications I can think of that merit their place are B and C.

link.title: Have I ever said before that I hate the phrase "seamlessly integrate"?
link.comment: not to me
well, this is a chance to bring a whole new dimension of dislike into our mutual knowledge.
coo, there's an offer you don't get every day.

link.title: Nonsense 0.6
link.comment: "Nonsense generates random (and sometimes humorous) text using a simple, recursive grammar. It's capable of producing the Slashdot homepage"
Confirming what we already thought...

link.title: I can't help feeling that this bot is overfeatured
link.comment: It's own custom programming language, skins for Windows...

link.title: Sexy Beast
link.comment: I'm off to the cinema this afternoon

link.title: Capturing, editing and replaying digital video
link.comment: I might need to read more about this later
